title: What ants teach us about the brain, cancer and the Internet
description: Ecologist Deborah Gordon studies ants wherever she can find them -- in the desert, in the tropics, in her kitchen ... In this fascinating talk, she explains her obsession with insects most of us would happily swat away without a second thought. She argues that ant life provides a useful model for learning about many other topics, including disease, technology and the human brain.
author: Deborah Gordon
keywords: TED, talks, ants, insects, nature, science, biomimicry, Internet, evolution, cancer, animals, algorithm, computers
